overview:
Ken is a member of the Marketing Team at Telx and is responsible for managing the digital media business.

In August 2012, Telx celebrated the grand opening of its new flagship data center in Santa Clara, California. “SCL2” the latest of Telx’s three Bay Area C3 facilities, offers premium colocation and interconnection capabilities as well as direct connectivity to the world’s leading carriers, ISP’s, cloud and content service providers. The 32,000 square foot carrier-neutral facility supports up to 400 watts per square foot. “SCL2” offers the best flexibility and network options to deliver content that meets the needs of demands of today’s multi-screen environment. In addition, the new facility follows green, energy-efficient standards in accordance with LEED requirements.

“Telx offers space, power, and high connectivity for today’s leading digital media companies,” said Ken Kajikawa, General Manager, Digital Media, for Telx. “Telx is committed to working with innovative digital media companies both in California and around the country to deliver high quality streaming content and the best user experience possible.”

About Telx Telx has the most connected data centers in the U.S., is a leading provider of interconnection and data center services in strategic, high-demand North American markets. With 17 premier C3 Cloud Connection Centers by Telx SM, Telx increases speed to market and reduces connectivity costs by providing direct connections to a community of the industry’s highest performance networks and access to 1,000+ customers, including leading telecommunications carriers, ISPs, cloud providers, content providers and enterprises. Telx is a privately held company headquartered in New York City.

Ken earned his MBA from Pepperdine University and a BS in Marketing from San Jose State University.
